translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

The government has received your letter dated the 23rd of the current month and is assured of what Your Excellency Captain Félix has reported regarding the enemy's movements.

The government has nothing to add to what it ordered you on the date of yesterday, but expects that you will frequently report everything that may be occurring, both concerning your march and that of Colonel Crescêncio, as well as the enemy's movements. Yesterday, Lieutenant Manuel Antônio was dispatched with all the regular soldiers and as many cavalry as could be arranged, to the point that we were left with only a few men for slaughtering.

If Your Excellency Juca Cipriano, Fialho, etc., remained in the rear guard, the government expects you to promptly inform it so that the necessary measures can be taken.

God preserve Your Excellency

Secretariat of War Affairs  
Vacacaí, March 24, 1840

Most Illustrious Sir Colonel João Antônio da Silveira  
Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Most Illustrious Sir Colonel João Antônio da Silveira,  
Commander of the Right Division,  
Wherever you may be found.

From the Ministry of War.
